commentary.line: That's it from this game. However, the entertainment continues, hop over to the Australia-Afghanistan game, where the Aussies are piling on the runs and Warner has a chance of getting a double hundred. Hope you enjoyed our coverage as much as we did bring it you. On behalf of Mani, Sriram and my co-commentator Sidhant Maheshwari, this is Akshay Maanay signing off. Until next time, take care and Adios!
@dkmohanty: After all the ridicules he gets, Umar Akmal is now 2nd in the list of most dismissals by wicket keepers in #CWC15 with 8 victims.
@FaisalJavedKhan: Misbah proved it today if there is a solid start and other batsmen stay on the wicket he can play fast. #PakvsUAE #CWC15
@Saj_PakPassion: Shahid Afridi goes ahead of Shaun Pollock & up to 5th place in the list of leading wicket takers in ODIs #cwc15 #PakvUAE
@cricket_U: Pakistan win by 129 runs. They have done their NRAJ a huge favour. Above Ireland now and slightly below West Indies. #PakvUAE
Lets have a look at some of the tweets from this game:

Misbah: "That's a much needed win for us and obviously we won by a big margin. So, now we can just relax a little bit on the net run-rate also. But, the next game is a very important for us and we need to focus on that."

Tauqir: "Definitely, I think 340 something was a big total for us. But, quite a few positives from the batting side. Batting all 50 overs was a very good effort and we are happy with this effort. He (Shaiman Anwar) is a very good batsman and he is very confident player in the team. His nickname in the dressing room is Sir Viv (smiles). We wanted to put up a decent performance throughout the tournament. We had quite a few good games against Zimbabwe and Ireland. I think even today the effort was decent and going forward also we would like to do well."

Shehzad: "Pretty much satisified before the big game. Everybody had a look at us with what happened in the last game against Zimbabwe. Wahab (Riaz) really helped us a lot with his innings. Of course we didn't want to be in the similar kind of situation. So, everybody took the responsibility and I pushed myself up. I worked hard with the batting coach and other coaches as well. Everybody has been very supportive. I am very happy to see the way Haris Sohail batted and in the end the way Misbah and Sohaib Maqsood finished the innings. I am very pleased to see them, you know getting the momentum at the right time before the big game against South Africa. We have got no other choice, we need to stand up as a team and we need to show character there."
Ahmed Shehzad is the Man of the Match for his 93.
Our man, Jamie at the ground tells us, "So the crowd of 2,400 people didn't get a great game. Pakistan won't mind, beating UAE to stay alive."

Earlier in the day, riding on fifties from Shehzad, Sohail and Misbah, Pakistan managed to post 339/6 on the board, their second highest total in a World Cup game. They scored 124 runs off the final 10 overs and 71 off their last 5, all thanks to some good hitting from their lower order. Their batting was great, but the Pakistanis would feel that they should have done much better with the ball.

On the other hand, the Pakistani bowlers bowled well in patches, especially Sohail Khan, who was the chief destroyer. In his first spell of 7 overs, he picked up 2 wickets and gave away just 25 runs. However, Javed carved Sohail for 20, including 2 sixes and 2 fours in his 8th over. The other bowlers chipped in with a few good overs as well, but they lacked the killer instinct as they failed to pick up all the wickets.

Khurram Khan fell for 43 in the 30th over, but Shaiman Anwar kept battling through the middle stages. He registered yet another fifty, his 3rd fifty plus score in this edition of the World Cup. He also overtook Kumar Sangakkara, to become the top run-scorer in the World Cup till now. After Anwar departed on 62, Patil and Javed then took on the mantle of keeping the Pakistani bowlers out. They did extremely well in the final overs. Patil knocked the ball around and looked for singles while Javed hit a few lusty blows out of the park to provide some entertainment to the crowd. In fact, this is UAE's highest score against any top 8 nation in ODIs.

So, the inevitable result is out and Pakistan have won this by a big margin. After UAE lost 3 wickets in quick succession at the start of the innings, there was only one result possible from this game and that was a Pakistani win. Even though Khurram Khan and Shaiman Anwar put on 83 runs together to steady the innings, it was never enough to give UAE a chance to take the game away from Pakistan's grasp.

49.6   Riaz to M Tauqir, no run, Pakistan have won by 129 runs. The players shake hands with each other. Fullish and on off, Tauqir comes half-forward and knocks it to cover. That was bowled with a cross seam. The UAE players come out to congratulate their opposition
Mohammad Tauqir, right handed bat, comes to the crease

49.5   Riaz to Swapnil Patil, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! It is a perfect delivery from Riaz. The umpire checks for a no-ball, it is fine. A yorker aimed right at the base of off-stump, Patil makes room and fails to lay bat on that, the ball crashes into the stumps and sends the bails flashing. Swapnil Patil b Riaz 36(68) [4s-2]
Riaz to Swapnil Patil, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

Mohammad Naveed, right handed bat, comes to the crease

49.2   Riaz to Amjad Javed, out Caught by Sohail Khan!! An entertaining innings comes to an end. Sohail Khan throws the ball in frustration. It was banged in midway down the wicket, Javed goes for the pull, splices it to long-on, Sohail settles under it and reverse cups it safely. Amjad Javed c Sohail Khan b Riaz 40(33) [4s-5 6s-2]
Riaz to Amjad Javed, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

48.4   Sohail Khan to Amjad Javed, FOUR, another streaky boundary for Javed! Full and tailing in, Javed clears his front leg and goes for the heave, the ball squirts off the inside edge to the right of short fine leg

47.5   Riaz to Amjad Javed, FOUR, edged and four! Javed is having some fun now. These runs will hurt Pakistan as it will effect their overall run-rate. Shortens the length around, Javed goes for the hoick towards cow corner, the ball takes the top-edge and flies down to third man fence

47.3   Riaz to Swapnil Patil, 2 runs, comical from Jamshed. Back of a length just outside off, Patil slashes it down to third man, it bounced a couple of times before reaching Jamshed, who allows it to slip through his legs, then has to dive and stop the ball from reaching the fence. It was a straightforward save which he messed up

Riaz has been warned for the second time for running on the danger area. He can continue though, because it is the third official warning that will not allow him to bowl. I apologize for getting it wrong the first time, when I told it was after the second warning.

38.3   Afridi to Rohan Mustafa, out Caught by Ahmed Shehzad!! Afridi takes 2 in 3 balls. Mustafa walks back to the hut. It was floated up, Mustafa kneels down and looks to sweep, but picks out Shehzad at backward square leg, who won't drop those. Mustafa is very disappointed and Afridi has his arms aloft in joy. He was trying to reverse cup it and almost dropped it, but somehow recovers in time to take it on the second attempt. Shaiman Anwar c Jamshed b Afridi 62(88) [4s-4 6s-2]

Shaiman Anwar has now become the top-scorer in the World Cup.

Drinks are on the field now. UAE are not playing for the win here, they are looking to bat out their 50 overs. On the other hand, Pakistan have also failed to kill the game. We know the result, but let's see how much can UAE make.

Apart from Naveed and Tauqir to a certain extent, the other UAE bowlers were very disappointing. They failed to put pressure on the Pakistanis, especially during the final 10 overs. Now, it is upto their batsmen to put on a show, but with Irfan and Riaz in the team, Pakistan will be confident of defending this total. Folks, take a break for now and be back in a short while for the run-chase.

Both of them were looking set to reach their respective hundreds, but threw their wickets away in the batting powerplay. Sohail got out trying to pull one out of the park and Shehzad was run-out trying to sneak in a second, that too in his nineties. After those two departed, Maqsood and Misbah then took the attack to the opposition, by hitting a few lusty blows out of the park. Maqsood made a 31-ball 45 before getting out, while Misbah notched up a quickfire fifty and finished with 65 off just 49 balls.

So, Pakistan finish with 339/6 on the board, the 16th time in 25 matches this World Cup that a team has gone past 300. Earlier, Pakistan got off to a poor start, losing Nasir Jamshed early in the innings. After that Sohail and Shehzad steadied the innings and played the balls according to their merit. Both of them completed their maiden World Cup fifties and also put on 160 runs for the second wicket, the first 100+ partnership for Pakistan in this World Cup.

Drinks are on the field now. Both Shehzad and Sohail did well in this period to compile Pakistan's first 100-plus partnership in this tournament, bringing up their respective fifties in the meantime as well. However, the job is still half done for the Pakistanis as they look to make the most out of the batting powerplay. Shehzad is nearing his hundred and he will look to cut loose once he reaches the landmark.

Drinks are on the field now. Pakistan got off to a disastrous start with Nasir Jamshed failing once again. However, these two have since then put on a 50-plus partnership to steady the innings. UAE have only themselves to blame as they dropped Shehzad twice in this period. Even though the first chance was a little difficult, the second one was a regulation catch. Pakistan have improved their run-rate as well, but there's still a long way to go...

The teams are done with the national anthems. The openers stride out to the middle. UAE players are also out there. Nasir Jamshed will take the strike first. Mohammad Naveed will open the bowling with two slips in place.
Teams:

United Arab Emirates (Playing XI): Amjad Ali, Andri Berenger, Krishnachandran Karate, Khurram Khan, Shaiman Anwar, Swapnil Patil(w), Rohan Mustafa, Amjad Javed, Mohammad Naveed, Mohammad Tauqir(c), Manjula Guruge
Pakistan (Playing XI): Nasir Jamshed, Ahmed Shehzad, Haris Sohail, Misbah-ul-Haq(c), Umar Akmal(w), Sohaib Maqsood, Shahid Afridi, Wahab Riaz, Sohail Khan, Rahat Ali, Mohammad Irfan
United Arab Emirates have won the toss and have opted to field

Tauqir: "We had one bad game. We discussed about it, identified what mistakes we did and are ready for this game. We will be bowling first. It looks like a good wicket and with overcast conditions, we want to put pressure on them. He (Shaiman Anwar) has been batting well. Hopefully, the other batters can also do well."

Misbah: "I think nowadays every team knows each other, their games. Especially, the coaches are woking really well with them, specially Aaqib (Javed). So, lets see, we are ready and we need to play really. We are got the same team. And I think we are happy to bat first. The last two games we played here, it was a really good batting pitch. We also played well and in the last game, New Zealand also played really well against us. It is a good batting pitch and it is a really good chance for our batsmen to get back into form. Every game is important and we have no other chance, because we have to win every game. We have to play every game to the best of our capabilities. We need to be more professional. We need a clinical performance in both batting and bowling, especially fielding. We are ready for that."

With many players of the UAE side having a Pakistani connection, it will be interesting to see how they go about their job against the Men in Green. Will Pakistan continue to employ the strategy of having an extra bowler? Or whether Nasir Jamshed will make way for another batsman? Stay tuned for the toss and the teams.

McLean Park has been a high scoring ground in the recent past. New Zealand made 359 for 5 here against Pakistan last month, a game they won by 119 runs. It will be interesting to see whether the team winning the toss decides to bat first here. This game will become all the more important for Pakistan, who will look to boost their net run-rate.
Pakistan

After losing two consecutive games to India and the West Indies, Pakistan finally opened their account on the points table with a win over Zimbabwe. Misbah won the toss, but his team got off to a poor start. Both the Pakistani openers, Shehzad and Jamshed were back in the hut with just 4 runs on the board. Misbah then steadied the innings with Haris Sohail, who once again threw it away after getting off to a start. Pakistan lost wickets from time to time and if it was not for Wahab Riaz's unbeaten 46-ball 54, Pakistan would have struggled to post 235 on the board.

In reply, their bowlers did extremely well. Even though the Zimbabwean middle-order was threatening to take them the distance, Wahab Riaz and Mohammad Irfan made sure that they kept a tight leash on the batsmen. Both of them finished with 4 wickets each and helped Pakistan bowl Zimbabwe out for 215. This was a much needed win for Pakistan and even though it was not a convincing one, they wouldn't mind the two points they got.
UAE

UAE's last game was a one-sided affair as India thrashed them by 9 wickets. After winning the toss and deciding to bat first, Mohammad Tauqir's men failed to get going. They kept losing wickets and at one stage, they were staring at a score of less than a 100 on the board. It was only after Shaiman Anwar's knock of 35 and a last wicket partnership of 31 runs that the team managed to cross 100, but only just.

Chasing 103 to win, India were never going to be put under pressure. After Rohan Mustafa's brilliant fielding effort sent Dhawan back to the pavilion, Rohit and Kohli made sure that they don't give anything away to UAE. Both of them finished unbeaten and UAE's search for a win still continues.

11:45 Local Time, 23:45 GMT, 05:15 IST: The first game today is an all Asian contest, with Pakistan and UAE locking horns in the coastal city of Napier. Even though Pakistan is a much more accomplished international team, only two points separate these two sides at the bottom of Pool B. However, a win for Pakistan here will lift them above Zimbabwe for sure. Before we go any further, let's take a look at the form guide of both the teams.
Teams:

United Arab Emirates (From): Amjad Ali, Andri Berenger, Krishnachandran Karate, Khurram Khan, Swapnil Patil(k), Shaiman Anwar, Rohan Mustafa, Amjad Javed, Mohammad Naveed, Mohammad Tauqir(c), Manjula Guruge, Nasir Aziz, Fahad Alhashmi, Kamran Shazad, Saqlain Haider

Pakistan (From): Nasir Jamshed, Ahmed Shehzad, Haris Sohail, Misbah-ul-Haq(c), Umar Akmal(k), Shahid Afridi, Sohaib Maqsood, Wahab Riaz, Sohail Khan, Rahat Ali, Mohammad Irfan, Younis Khan, Ehsan Adil, Yasir Shah, Sarfraz Ahmed
